template.name: DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP
template.description:
Template for DELL PowerEdge R820 servers with iDRAC version 7 and later.
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 SNMPv2-MIB
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/426752-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-dell-templates
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: Dell R820: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Dell R820: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Dell R820: Firmware version
item.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the firmware version of a remote access card.

trigger.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.firmware[racFirmwareVersion],#1)<>last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.firmware[racFirmwareVersion],#2) and length(last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.firmware[racFirmwareVersion]))>0
trigger.name: Dell R820: Firmware has changed
trigger.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Dell R820: Hardware model name
item.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the model name of the system.

item.name: Dell R820: Hardware serial number
item.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the service tag of the system.

trigger.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.serialnumber[systemServiceTag],#1)<>last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.serialnumber[systemServiceTag],#2) and length(last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.serialnumber[systemServiceTag]))>0
trigger.name: Dell R820: Device has been replaced
trigger.event_name: Dell R820: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item.name: Dell R820: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: Dell R820: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., 'telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Dell R820: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.name[sysName],#1)<>last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.name[sysName],#2) and length(last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.name[sysName]))>0
trigger.name: Dell R820: System name has changed
trigger.event_name: Dell R820: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Dell R820: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Dell R820: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining 'what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor 'Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its 'Fred Router'.

item.name: Dell R820: Overall system health status
item.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the overall rollup status of all components in the system being monitored by the remote access card. Includes system, storage, IO devices, iDRAC, CPU, memory, etc.

trigger.name: Dell R820: System is in unrecoverable state
trigger.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger.name: Dell R820: System status is in critical state
trigger.description: Please check the device for errors.

trigger.name: Dell R820: System status is in warning state
trigger.description: Please check the device for warnings.

dependency.name: Dell R820: System status is in critical state

item.name: Dell R820: Operating system
item.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the name of the operating system that the host is running.

trigger.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sw.os[systemOSName],#1)<>last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sw.os[systemOSName],#2) and length(last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sw.os[systemOSName]))>0
trigger.name: Dell R820: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: Operating system description has changed. Possibly, the system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

item.name: Dell R820: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

trigger.name: Dell R820: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

discovery_rule.name: Array controller cache discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Array controllers: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2::batteryTable

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#BATTERY_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 Current state of battery. Possible values: 1: The current state could not be determined. 2: The battery is operating normally. 3: The battery has failed and needs to be replaced. 4: The battery temperature is high or charge level is depleting. 5: The battery is missing or not detected. 6: The battery is undergoing the re-charge phase. 7: The battery voltage or charge level is below the threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#BATTERY_NAME} is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#BATTERY_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

dependency.name: Dell R820: {#BATTERY_NAME} is in critical state

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#BATTERY_NAME} is not in optimal state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

dependency.name: Dell R820: {#BATTERY_NAME} is in critical state
Dell R820: {#BATTERY_NAME} is in warning state

discovery_rule.name: Array controller discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Array controllers: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2::controllerTable

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#CNTLR_NAME} Model
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The controller's name as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#CNTLR_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The status of the controller itself without the propagation of any contained component status. Possible values: 1: Other 2: Unknown 3: OK 4: Non-critical 5: Critical 6: Non-recoverable

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#CNTLR_NAME} is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

dependency.name: Dell R820: {#CNTLR_NAME} is in unrecoverable state

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#CNTLR_NAME} is in unrecoverable state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#CNTLR_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

dependency.name: Dell R820: {#CNTLR_NAME} is in critical state
Dell R820: {#CNTLR_NAME} is in unrecoverable state

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#FAN_DESCR} Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the reading for a cooling device of subtype other than coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete. When the value for coolingDeviceSubType is other than coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete, the value returned for this attribute is the speed in RPM or the OFF/ON value of the cooling device. When the value for coolingDeviceSubType is coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete, a value is not returned for this attribute.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#FAN_DESCR} Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the probe status of the cooling device.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalLower"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableLower"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"failed"}
trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#FAN_DESCR} is in critical state

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.WARN:"nonCriticalUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.WARN:"nonCriticalLower"}
trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#FAN_DESCR} is in warning state

dependency.name: Dell R820: {#FAN_DESCR} is in critical state
dependency.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalLower"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableLower"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.fan.status[coolingDeviceStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$FAN.STATUS.CRIT:"failed"}

discovery_rule.name: Physical disk discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of physical drive entries IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2::physicalDiskTable.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Media type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The media type of the physical disk. Possible Values: 1: The media type could not be determined. 2: Hard Disk Drive (HDD). 3: Solid State Drive (SSD).

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Model name
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The model number of the physical disk.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The physical disk's unique identification number from the manufacturer.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[physicalDiskSerialNo.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[physicalDiskSerialNo.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[physicalDiskSerialNo.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} has been replaced
trigger_prototype.event_name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: {#DISK_NAME} serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Size
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The size of the physical disk in megabytes.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} S.M.A.R.T. Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 Indicates whether the physical disk has received a predictive failure alert.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.smart_status[physicalDiskSmartAlertIndication.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.SMART.STATUS.FAIL:"replaceDrive"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.smart_status[physicalDiskSmartAlertIndication.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.SMART.STATUS.FAIL:"replaceDriveSSDWearOut"}
trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} S.M.A.R.T. failed

dependency.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} failed
dependency.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.status[physicalDiskComponentStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.STATUS.FAIL:"critical"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.status[physicalDiskComponentStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.STATUS.FAIL:"nonRecoverable"}

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The status of the physical disk itself without the propagation of any contained component status. Possible values: 1: Other 2: Unknown 3: OK 4: Non-critical 5: Critical 6: Non-recoverable

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.status[physicalDiskComponentStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.STATUS.FAIL:"critical"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.status[physicalDiskComponentStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.STATUS.FAIL:"nonRecoverable"}
trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} failed
trigger_prototype.description: Please check physical disk for warnings or errors.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check physical disk for warnings or errors.

dependency.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} failed
dependency.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.status[physicalDiskComponentStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.STATUS.FAIL:"critical"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.physicaldisk.status[physicalDiskComponentStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$DISK.STATUS.FAIL:"nonRecoverable"}

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#PSU_DESCR}
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 0600.0012.0001.0005 This attribute defines the status of the power supply.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.psu.status[powerSupplyStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$PSU.STATUS.CRIT:"critical"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.psu.status[powerSupplyStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$PSU.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverable"}
trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: Power supply {#PSU_DESCR} is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: Power supply {#PSU_DESCR} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors.

dependency.name: Dell R820: Power supply {#PSU_DESCR} is in critical state
dependency.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.psu.status[powerSupplyStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$PSU.STATUS.CRIT:"critical"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.psu.status[powerSupplyStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$PSU.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverable"}

discovery_rule.name: Temperature discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Probe Table IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2::temperatureProbeTable

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#SENSOR_LOCALE} Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the probe status of the temperature probe. Possible values: other(1), -- probe status is not one of the following: unknown(2), -- probe status is unknown (not known or monitored) ok(3), -- probe is reporting a value within the thresholds nonCriticalUpper(4), -- probe has crossed the upper noncritical threshold criticalUpper(5), -- probe has crossed the upper critical threshold nonRecoverableUpper(6), -- probe has crossed the upper non-recoverable threshold nonCriticalLower(7), -- probe has crossed the lower noncritical threshold criticalLower(8), -- probe has crossed the lower critical threshold nonRecoverableLower(9), -- probe has crossed the lower non-recoverable threshold failed(10) -- probe is not functional

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalLower"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableLower"}
trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: Probe {#SENSOR_LOCALE} is in critical status
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.WARN:"nonCriticalUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.WARN:"nonCriticalLower"}
trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: Probe {#SENSOR_LOCALE} is in warning status
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

dependency.name: Dell R820: Probe {#SENSOR_LOCALE} is in critical status
dependency.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalLower"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableLower"}

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: Probe {#SENSOR_LOCALE} is not in optimal status
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

dependency.name: Dell R820: Probe {#SENSOR_LOCALE} is in critical status
dependency.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"criticalLower"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.CRIT:"nonRecoverableLower"}

dependency.name: Dell R820: Probe {#SENSOR_LOCALE} is in warning status
dependency.expression: last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.WARN:"nonCriticalUpper"} or last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.sensor.temp.status[temperatureProbeStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])={$SENSOR.TEMP.STATUS.WARN:"nonCriticalLower"}

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#SENSOR_LOCALE} Value
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 This attribute defines the reading for a temperature probe of type other than temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete. When the value for temperatureProbeType is other than temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete, the value returned for this attribute is the temperature that the probe is reading in Centigrade. When the value for temperatureProbeType is temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete, a value is not returned for this attribute.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Layout type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The virtual disk's RAID type. Possible values: 1: Not one of the following 2: RAID-0 3: RAID-1 4: RAID-5 5: RAID-6 6: RAID-10 7: RAID-50 8: RAID-60 9: Concatenated RAID 1 10: Concatenated RAID 5

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Read policy
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The read policy used by the controller for read operations on this virtual disk. Possible values: 1: No Read Ahead. 2: Read Ahead. 3: Adaptive Read Ahead.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Size
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The size of the virtual disk in megabytes.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Current state
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The state of the virtual disk when there are progressive operations ongoing. Possible values: 1: There is no active operation running. 2: The virtual disk configuration has changed. The physical disks included in the virtual disk are being modified to support the new configuration. 3: A Consistency Check (CC) is being performed on the virtual disk. 4: The virtual disk is being initialized. 5: BackGround Initialization (BGI) is being performed on the virtual disk.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The current state of this virtual disk (which includes any member physical disks.) Possible states: 1: The current state could not be determined. 2: The virtual disk is operating normally or optimally. 3: The virtual disk has encountered a failure. Data on the disk is lost or is about to be lost. 4: The virtual disk encountered a failure with one or all of the constituent redundant physical disks. The data on the virtual disk might no longer be fault tolerant.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} failed
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the virtual disk for warnings or errors.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the virtual disk for warnings or errors.

item_prototype.name: Dell R820: {#DISK_NAME} Write policy
item_prototype.description: MIB: IDRAC-MIB-SMIv2 The write policy used by the controller for write operations on this virtual disk. Possible values: 1: Write Through. 2: Write Back. 3: Force Write Back.

macro.description: The critical status of the disk array cache battery for trigger expression.
The OK status of the disk array cache battery for trigger expression.
The warning status of the disk array cache battery for trigger expression.
The critical status of the disk array for trigger expression.
The disaster status of the disk array for trigger expression.
The warning status of the disk array for trigger expression.
The critical S.M.A.R.T status of the disk for trigger expression.
The critical status of the disk for trigger expression.
The critical status of the disk for trigger expression.
The warning status of the disk for trigger expression.
The critical value of the FAN sensor for trigger expression.
The critical value of the FAN sensor for trigger expression.
The critical value of the FAN sensor for trigger expression.
The critical value of the FAN sensor for trigger expression.
The critical value of the FAN sensor for trigger expression.
The warning value of the FAN sensor for trigger expression.
The warning value of the FAN sensor for trigger expression.
The critical status of the health for trigger expression.
The disaster status of the health for trigger expression.
The warning status of the health for trigger expression.
The critical value of the PSU sensor for trigger expression.
The critical value of the PSU sensor for trigger expression.
The warning value of the PSU sensor for trigger expression.
The critical status of the temperature probe for trigger expression.
The critical status of the temperature probe for trigger expression.
The critical status of the temperature probe for trigger expression.
The critical status of the temperature probe for trigger expression.
The OK status of the temperature probe for trigger expression.
The warning status of the temperature probe for trigger expression.
The warning status of the temperature probe for trigger expression.
The time interval for SNMP agent availability trigger expression.
The critical status of the virtual disk for trigger expression.
The warning status of the virtual disk for trigger expression.

trigger.expression: (last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime])>0 and last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime])<10m) or (last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime])=0 and last(/DELL PowerEdge R820 by SNMP/dell.server.net.uptime[sysUpTime])<10m)
trigger.name: Dell R820: Host has been restarted
